channel.title: Hab on Jason Madigan
channel.description: Recent content in Hab on Jason Madigan

item.title: High Altitude Adventures - Part 3
item.description: A few weeks ago, I was mostly ready to launch. We’d bought an N30 cylinder of Helium from Irish Party Supplies, containing 7.82mÂ³ of Helium - enough for roughly two launches of a standard sized 1000g balloon. Previously, I’d thought hydrogen would be a better choice, but considering it was a first launch we decided to play it safe (after having a gas seller painstakingly explain the various ways in which Hydrogen tanks can explode).

item.title: High Altitude Adventures - Part 2
item.description:
Following on from my previous post, I’m going to go into a little more detail as to what we’re planning and what I’ve built so far - hopefully it will be of interest!

The payload (or safeload as I’m now calling it) is now complete. It consists of:

  • An Arduino Mega 2560
  • MTK3339 GPS
  • Radiometrix NTX2 (434.650MHz @ 10mW)
  • Xexun TK102 GPS Tracker
  • Veho Muvi HD 1080p Camcorder
  • Siemens TC35 RS232 GSM modem

item.title: High Altitude Adventures
item.description: A few weeks ago, I spied a video on YouTube via Reddit - some guys had gotten together and put some cameras high up into the atmosphere (100,000ft, ~30km). I looked at it and thought it seemed like a good use of time. I got talking to a friend of mine at work about the possibilites of launching something like this from Ireland. As it turned out, some people from launched successfully from Kerry a few years back.
